name: places/ChIJQ2ar5EBZwokROyxuXSieQrU
formattedAddress: 15 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: Only had drinks here. Their kitchen was closed by the time I got here. I think it was around 10pm. From what I saw on people's table, the food looks delicious which was confirmed by a friend who's eaten here several times. They have some nice beer, wine and cocktail options. I had the Sancerre myself.

text.text: Only had drinks here. Their kitchen was closed by the time I got here. I think it was around 10pm. From what I saw on people's table, the food looks delicious which was confirmed by a friend who's eaten here several times. They have some nice beer, wine and cocktail options. I had the Sancerre myself.

originalText.text: Had a meat and cheese board and it took over 30 minutes to get it with only a handful of tables. Tasted fine but wasn’t served with the menu items. Call themselves a wine and beer bar but didn’t have much for wine options. Fruit flies were thick too so not a spot I can recommend.

text.text: Had a meat and cheese board and it took over 30 minutes to get it with only a handful of tables. Tasted fine but wasn’t served with the menu items. Call themselves a wine and beer bar but didn’t have much for wine options. Fruit flies were thick too so not a spot I can recommend.

originalText.text: Not the best place to go to experience a classy bar experience. First of all, it's extremely difficult to catch a worker here because the only one working in the entire restaurant is one bartender. There are no servers nor people at the front to check you in. You just sit at any table as if you're at a food court, and you have to walk up to the bartender to put in your order for both food and drinks. I didn't know that at first, so I was just sitting at my table waiting for someone to come serve. And because there is only one bartender, the drinks came out very late—ordered a cocktail and I finally got it after 30-40 mins. The food aren't that great either: guac wasn't fresh, chips were too salty and the chicken kebabs were unpleasantly bland. Luckily for me, the bland chicken was perfect to counter the salty chips and guac.

originalText.text:
Best thing that could have happened to this neighborhood.

Food - this is not bar food.  They have great selection at great prices.

Prices - this place is very affordable. The food is great for the prices and the regular prices are reasonable. And they have HH every day!

Space - plenty of places to sit. Tables and couches.

Staff - extremely friendly. We have started to get to know these guys. They are great.

I love this place.

originalText.text: I spent 30 min shopping there today. I've been a customer even tho it's double the price since 2019. I have always brought my emotional support dog with me. Before I checked out, I ordered a sandwich to go. With a full basket of groceries and waiting for the sandwich a woman walked up to me and said, "you'll have to leave, no dogs allowed." Not asking if I had papers on my phone, just, "leave". The staff there have always been aloof/rude but it never bothered me that much. The store had about 5 guests shopping. They just lost a neighborhood source of income.
